# UITouch.Phase.regionMoved

**Case**

A touch for the given event is within a window on the screen, but has not yet pressed down.

## Declaration

```swift
case regionMoved
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITouch/Phase-swift.enum/regionEntered], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITouch/Phase-swift.enum/regionMoved], and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITouch/Phase-swift.enum/regionExited] phases don’t always align with the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGestureRecognizer/state-swift.property] property of a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIHoverGestureRecognizer]. States of the hover gesture recognizer only apply within the context of the gesture’s view, whereas the touch states apply within the window.

## Constants

- **UITouch.Phase.began**: A touch for a given event has pressed down on the screen.
- **UITouch.Phase.moved**: A touch for a given event has moved over the screen.
- **UITouch.Phase.stationary**: A touch for a given event is pressed down on the screen, but hasn’t moved since the previous event.
- **UITouch.Phase.ended**: A touch for a given event has lifted from the screen.
- **UITouch.Phase.cancelled**: The system canceled tracking for a touch, for example, when the user moves the device against their face.
- **UITouch.Phase.regionEntered**: A touch for a given event has entered a window on the screen.
- **UITouch.Phase.regionExited**: A touch for a given event has left a window on the screen.
